citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
Pertaining to IACUC approved Protocol 4680: Expired euthanasia solution was identified in an investigator area by
members of the IACUC during the semi-annual facility inspection in October 2024; the exp date on the bottle of
euthanasia solution was 6/24/24. The IACUC determined that the investigator staff had performed a total of 9 perfusions
using the expired euthanasia solution up to 7/17/24. According to veterinary personnel who were present during the
perfusions, the reflexes of the research animals were checked during the procedures and no pain or distress were noted
in any of the animals.
Per this Section, each research facility shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the
use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases or injuries. The use of medications that are
past the manufacturer’s expiration date in research animals is not considered providing adequate veterinary care.
Outdated drugs may not be as effective or may have unexpected effects in the animals. The research facility addressed
this incident prior to the inspection by providing retraining to investigator staff on ensuring that all medications used on
research animals are in date, revision of surgical recordkeeping forms to include the expiration dates of all medications
administered to animals, and additional training of investigator staff on surgical records and drug storage. No additional
incidents have occurred. To remain corrected from this date 2/25/25 forward.

One Dark-eyed Junco was not handled as carefully as possible by investigator staff during an IACUC approved study
procedure on 6/24/24. An error was made by the investigator when setting up the environmental chamber that resulted in
the death of the bird due to inadequate airflow settings. Investigator staff corrected the airflow settings, and the metabolic
chamber was then used in the successful testing of thirty-nine birds.
Per this Section, the handling of animals by all personnel, including investigator research staff, should be done as
carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause physical harm or unnecessary discomfort. The Dark-eyed Junco
was not handled as carefully as possible during the study procedure when the airflow settings for the chamber were set at
an inadequate level that led to its death. The research facility addressed this incident prior to the inspection by
implementing corrective measures including retraining of investigator staff on the operation of the environmental chamber,
placing additional labelling of the gas lines to/from the chamber, and review of all procedures by veterinary staff. No
additional incidents have occurred.
This inspection was conducted with facility representatives from 2/24/25 through 2/25/25. The exit briefing was held
2/25/25.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
2.33(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
Pertaining to IACUC approved Protocol 4680: Expired euthanasia solution was identified in an investigator area by 
members of the IACUC during the semi-annual facility inspection in October 2024; the exp date on the bottle of 
euthanasia solution was 6/24/24. The IACUC determined that the investigator staff had performed a total of 9 perfusions 
using the expired euthanasia solution up to 7/17/24. According to veterinary personnel who were present during the 
perfusions, the reflexes of the research animals were checked during the procedures and no pain or distress were noted 
in any of the animals. 
 
Per this Section, each research facility shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the 
use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases or injuries. The use of medications that are 
past the manufacturer’s expiration date in research animals is not considered providing adequate veterinary care. 
Outdated drugs may not be as effective or may have unexpected effects in the animals. The research facility addressed 
this incident prior to the inspection by providing retraining to investigator staff on ensuring that all medications used on 
research animals are in date, revision of surgical recordkeeping forms to include the expiration dates of all medications 
administered to animals, and additional training of investigator staff on surgical records and drug storage. No additional 
incidents have occurred. To remain corrected from this date 2/25/25 forward. 
2.38(f)(1)  Critical Repeat
   
Miscellaneous. 
One Dark-eyed Junco was not handled as carefully as possible by investigator staff during an IACUC approved study 
procedure on 6/24/24. An error was made by the investigator when setting up the environmental chamber that resulted in 
the death of the bird due to inadequate airflow settings. Investigator staff corrected the airflow settings, and the metabolic 
chamber was then used in the successful testing of thirty-nine birds. 
 
Per this Section, the handling of animals by all personnel, including investigator research staff, should be done as 
carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause physical harm or unnecessary discomfort. The Dark-eyed Junco 
was not handled as carefully as possible during the study procedure when the airflow settings for the chamber were set at 
an inadequate level that led to its death. The research facility addressed this incident prior to the inspection by

implementing corrective measures including retraining of investigator staff on the operation of the environmental chamber, 
placing additional labelling of the gas lines to/from the chamber, and review of all procedures by veterinary staff. No 
additional incidents have occurred. 
 
This inspection was conducted with facility representatives from 2/24/25 through 2/25/25. The exit briefing was held 
2/25/25. 
 
*END OF REPORT*
